Detailed Description

Volume Struct.

If vol is one Volume structure returned by adfMount() :

  • The devType is vol->dev->devType.
  • The dosType is OFS or FFS (exclusive) and may have the DIRCACHE and INTERNATIONAL modes enabled. Use isFFS(vol->dosType), isOFS(), isINTL() and isDIRCACHE() to determine it.
Warning! Even if isINTL() returns FALSE, if isDIRCACHE() is TRUE, the Volume is considered (as with AmigaDOS) as having the international mode enabled!

Field Documentation

SECTNUM* Volume::bitmapBlocks
 

Bitmap blocks pointer, (excluding bitmap extensions blocks).

BOOL* Volume::bitmapBlocksChg
 

Array of bitmap block change flags. TRUE if bitmapTable[i} has changed and needs to be written at bitmapBlocks[i].

long Volume::bitmapSize
 

Bitmap size in blocks, excluding the bitmapExtension blocks.

struct bBitmapBlock** Volume::bitmapTable
 

Pointer to an array of bitmap block structs.

int Volume::blockSize
 

512.

BOOL Volume::bootCode
 

Boot code flag. TRUE if a floppy is bootable.

SECTNUM Volume::curDirPtr
 

The sector number of the current directory.

int Volume::datablockSize
 

488 or 512.

struct Device* Volume::dev
 

The parent device.

char Volume::dosType
 

FFS/OFS, DIRCACHE, INTERNATIONAL.

SECTNUM Volume::firstBlock
 

First block of data area (from beginning of device).

SECTNUM Volume::lastBlock
 

Last block of data area (from beginning of device).

BOOL Volume::mounted
 

Mount flag.

BOOL Volume::readOnly
 

Read-only flag.

SECTNUM Volume::rootBlock
 

Root block (from firstBlock)

char* Volume::volName
 

Volume name.
